In a nice world, low unemployment and low employment reflect lots of retired boomers and studying millennials. In a less nice world, people leave the labour force because there's no point looking for work and no benefits available for doing so

You can ask employers how many people they employ and survey people to ask them if they are a) employed, b) in education/training c) unemployed or d) none of the above. Labour force is a+c. Population is all of it. High b and high d depress employment rate at low unemployment
